Rubrik Polaris SDK for Python¶

Package Functions¶

Core Rubrik Functions¶

Collection of methods that interact with Polaris primitives.

rubrik_polaris.lib.common.core.get_event_series_list(self, object_type=[], status=[], activity_type=[], severity=[], cluster_ids=[], start_time=None, end_time=None)¶

Retrieve Events from Polaris

Parameters:
  • {[str]} -- Array of Object Types (object_type) –
  • {[str]} -- Array of Event Status (status) –
  • {[str]} -- Array of Activity Types (activity_type) –
  • {[str]} -- Array of severities (severity) –
  • {[UUID]} -- Array of Cluster IDs (cluster_ids) –
  • {datetime} -- Timestamp to start return set from (start_date) –
  • {datetime} -- Timestamp to end return set from (end_date) –
Returns:

arr of dict – An array of dictionaries of Event Data
rubrik_polaris.lib.common.core.get_sla_domains(self, sla_domain_name='')¶

Retrieves dictionary of SLA Domain Names and Identifiers.

Keyword Arguments:
 {str} -- Rubrik SLA Domain name (default (sla_domain_name) – {‘’})
Returns:str – ID for the given SLA Domain name as given by sla_domain_name dict – The complete set of SLA domains or a one element dict if a non-empty sla_domain_name is given and found.
rubrik_polaris.lib.common.core.get_snapshots(self, snappable_id, **kwargs)¶

Retrieve Snapshots for a Snappable from Polaris

Parameters:
  • {str} -- Object UUID (snappable_id) –
  • {str} -- Optional datetime of snapshot to return, or 'latest', or not defined to return all (recovery_point) –
Returns:

dict – A dictionary of snapshots or a single snapshot if ‘latest’ was passed as recovery_point. If no snapshots are found, an empty dict is returned.
rubrik_polaris.lib.common.core.get_task_status(self, task_chain_id)¶

Retrieve task status from Polaris

Parameters:{str} -- Task Chain UUID from request (task_chain_id) –
Returns:str – Task state
rubrik_polaris.lib.common.core.submit_assign_sla(self, object_ids, sla_id)¶

Submits a Rubrik SLA change for objects

Parameters:
  • {[str]} -- Array of Rubrik Object IDs (object_ids) –
  • {str} -- Rubrik SLA Domain ID (sla_id) –
Returns:

list – List of objects assigned the SLA
rubrik_polaris.lib.common.core.submit_on_demand(self, object_ids, sla_id, wait=False)¶

Submits On Demand Snapshot request for the given set of object id’s and assign the given SLA to the snapshots.

Parameters:
  • {[str]} -- Array of Rubrik Object IDs (object_ids) –
  • {str} -- Rubrik SLA Domain ID (sla_id) –
Keyword Arguments:
 

{bool} -- Threaded wait for all processes to complete (default (wait) – {False})
Returns:

list – List of errors if any occurred

Task Monitor Functions¶

Collection of methods that monitor tasks

Account Functions¶

Collection of functions that manipulate account components.

rubrik_polaris.lib.accounts.add_account_aws(self, regions=[], all=False, profiles=[], aws_access_key_id=None, aws_secret_access_key=None)¶

Adds AWS account to Polaris

Parameters:
  • {list} -- List of AWS regions to configure (regions) –
  • {bool} -- If true import all available profiles (Default (all) – False)
  • {list} -- List of explicit profiles to add (profiles) –
  • {str} -- AWS Access Key ID (aws_access_key_id) –
  • {str} -- AWS Access Key Secret (aws_secret_access_key) –
Returns:

bool – True if the account was added successfully, otherwise False.
rubrik_polaris.lib.accounts.delete_account_aws(self, profiles=[], all=False, aws_access_key_id=None, aws_secret_access_key=None)¶

Commits Delete AWS Account in Polaris, relies on local .aws

Parameters:
  • {bool} -- If true import all available profiles (Default (all) – False)
  • {list} -- List of explicit profiles to add (profiles) –
  • {str} -- AWS Access Key ID (aws_access_key_id) –
  • {str} -- AWS Access Key Secret (aws_secret_access_key) –
rubrik_polaris.lib.accounts.get_account_aws_native_id(self, profile='', aws_id=None, aws_secret=None)¶

Returns AWS Account ID from local config

Returns:str – AWS Account ID, AWS Account Name (if applicable)

rubrik_polaris.lib.accounts.update_account_aws(self, regions=[], all=False, profiles=[], aws_access_key_id=None, aws_secret_access_key=None)¶

Updates AWS account if configured in Polaris

Parameters:
  • {bool} -- If true import all available profiles (Default (all) – False)
  • {list} -- List of explicit profiles to add (profiles) –
  • {str} -- AWS Access Key ID (aws_access_key_id) –
  • {str} -- AWS Access Key Secret (aws_secret_access_key) –
Returns:

bool – True if the account was added successfully, otherwise False.

Retrieve all AWS EC2 instances from Polaris

Parameters:{str} -- A specific Object ID to retrieve (object_id) –
Returns:list – List of all the AWS EC2 instances or the specific instance if the object_id is passed.

Retrieves all Azure VM object IDs that match query

Parameters:
  • {bool} -- Set to false to match ANY defined criteria (match_all) –
  • {} -- Any top level object from the get_compute_azure call (kwargs) –
Returns:

list – List of all the Azure VM object id’s

Parameters:
  • {bool} -- Set to false to match ANY defined criteria (match_all) –
  • {name (tags) – value} – Allows simple qualification of tags
  • {} -- Any top level object from the get_compute_ec2 call (kwargs) –
Returns:

list – List of all the EC2 object id’s

rubrik_polaris.lib.compute.submit_compute_restore_azure(self, snapshot_id, **kwargs)¶

Submits a Restore of an Azure VM instance

Parameters:
  • {str} -- Snapshot ID to be restored (snapshot_id) –
  • {bool} -- Defaults to False (should_restore_tags) –
  • {bool} -- Defaults to False –
  • {bool} -- Return once complete Defaults to False (wait) –
Returns:

list – List of errors if any occurred during the restore
